posts.post_content:
I adore the art on this card, actually. I'm not sure why.  
  
I think Islandhome could be fixed by making it, "If you control no islands, sacrifice this creature. As long as an opponent controls an island, this creature is unblockable." It'd be a little weird on this card, but hey.

posts.post_content: Wizards never should have discontinued the Islandhome mechanic. There was so much design space, so much untapped potential and innovation. Like "Swamphome" or "Plainshome". But that would have been way to overpowered. I mean look at this guy. You actually get to attack if your opponent controls an Island. That is game breaking! I think I'm going make a deck with these and play in a Vintage tournament.

posts.post_content:
Islandhome.   
Afaik the only keyworded ability that got removed so far. For obvious reasons?   
I personally hope to never see such cards again, they're simply not playable.  
  
The second ability is rather a bad joke considering the conditions which are required to be met for this creature in order to be even able to attack. On top of that it's double-blue.
